ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how psychology applies in a lab setting and how to run psychology studies. I really appreciated gaining this knowledge and love working in the lab.
I learned about working in a psychology lab.

I learned about how research actually gets done in an academic setting. I got experience with asking research questions and using statistics and neuroimaging to examine data. I also learned about academic writing and the process of presenting findings.
I learned about how to design a research experiment, and what types of considerations you have to make when fixing flaws in research design
I developed the ability to think critically about research through participating in my own research and discussing current research in the field.
How to conduct research, how to write proposals, deep insights on the cognitive science of religion.
I learned how to conduct a research project, including important software, recruitment, data collection, and survey making methods.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths - lots of lab time engaged in experiments

The strength of this course is that it is self-directed and very flexible to what you are interested in. The weakness is that there isn't much structure, but if you are excited about carrying out research and taking initiative, that doesn't pose much of an issue.
I improved on my ability to develop a project and troubleshoot on the fly.
I really enjoyed doing research in cognitive science of religion.
This course could have had more structure, especially in terms of allowing me to investigate my own research project.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, working in a lab is an enriching experience.
Yes! This was a great way to learn what work is really like in a psychology lab
Yes! IF you have a lab and PI that is a good fit and is willing to help you learn and guide you through the process.
Yes. I think its really good to get research experience, and designing and running a neuroscience experiment is a somewhat unique experience that can provide lots of other useful skills
Yes! Professor Santos and the rest of the lab team do a great job facilitating learning through lab meetings and participation in research.
If you like doing research, for sure!
I would recommend this course to another student who has an advisor that is really supportive of them and their to facilitate their learning and investigation of their interests within the lab.
